newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end down on army role in govt.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end down on army role in govt.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended down on Tuesday amid bearish sentiment after President Farooq Leghari created a council giving the military a formal advisory role in government affairs, dealers said.
The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index ended 14.72 points, or 1.09 percent, down at 1,341.31. Losing stocks outpaced gainers 123 to 53 but volume rose to 23.8 million from Monday's 22.9 million.
Dull trading followed the creation of the council in which power tilts towards the presidency and military, a dealer said.
"Declining volume and falling index reflects the uncertainty and lack of confidence among investors," the dealer said. The market might open lower on Wednesday.
PTCL fell 0.70 to 23.85, Dewan Salman 1.10 to 31.65, Siemens 4.75 to 155, PSO 4.0 to 265, Fauji Fertilizer 1.50 to 67.50 and Adamjee Insurance 2.25 to 84.75.
